[spoiler]
Half Life 3 will never come out.  No; I mean as legitimately it will never come out.  The reason being is that the story is done and written and that, but apparently valve is making so much money off steam that they're no longer interested in making video games ever again and they have begun moving people away from the project.  It originally had a skeleton crew, but now that the story is done and written up they're moving everyone out.

Essentially they finished writing the story, but they're making too much money to care about making games anymore and chances are we will only ever see the game come out if steam starts no longer being profitable.
[/spoiler]

[bq="hype"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b548f7636872621e0009fa#post_55b548f7636872621e0009fa
can't blame them, i'd do the same[/bq]
The thing is though as profitable as valve is they're vastly over estimating their long term profits.


What I mean by this is that when you look at technological advances when steam first started out hosting video games for download cost a lot of money and since then the costs have gone down.  In say ten years chances are valve will be considered the villains because of how much of a profit they get off games versus the game developers; that's why steam sales sell like crazy because those price cuts are coming out of their cut of the money.

In say ten years I wouldn't be surprised if valve is thought of as the then current day equivalent EA for price gouging.


Valve currently is the 2006 equivalent of Youtube; in ten years time Valve is probably going to be the 2015 equivalent of Youtube where they fuck everyone over for money.

"@liamwhite1":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b54c0163687223f6000652#post_55b54c0163687223f6000652
Oh hey Liam; speaking of linux 2015 might finally be the year for linux on the desktop.

When you get down to it linux and android (since android is based off the linux) dominates windows and mac on everything except for servers and desktop computers.

The reason why linux might finally get it's chance is that microsoft is having the problem with windows 7 that they had with windows xp.  What I mean by this is that while windows 7 isn't amazing microsoft is having trouble getting people to upgrade.  I believe a fifth of windows users still use windows xp.  The problem with microsoft right now is that no matter how good windows 10 is chances are pretty high that people will still hang onto windows 7.  The reason why the timing couldn't be any worse is that with steamos around the corner they have to give customers a very good incentive to upgrade to windows 10.

While I don't think everyone will just switch over to linux overnight more than likely the majority of people will just stick with windows 7 and a fair chunk of people might migrate to steamos given that steamboxes sold out so fast.


Tl:dr; worst timing ever for windows 10 launch
